page.title: 02THE ENTERPRISE ZONE
page.content: The enterprise zone was designated on 11th June 1981 as Britain's first enterprise zone.It consists of 735 acres and is run by Swansea City Council.There are many benefits e.g. exemption from rates on industrial and commercial property.The Swansea enterprise park forms part of the historic lower Swansea Industrial Valley.In addition to the old collieries such works as the Rose Copper Works were located in what is now the enterprise park.At the end of the last war the decline of these works left behind a derelict landscape of waste tips, obsolete plant and buildings and redundant railway tracks.The only sign left of this now are the slag heaps to the south of the park, parts of the adjoining BSC Landore works and the now closed BSC Dyffryn works on the A 48.
